item.title: A forgotten member of the Quantum Club: Grete Hermann
item.description: The memory of the first time I heard about Grete Hermann is crystal clear. It was a hot June day during one of the endless lockdown periods. I was studying for my History of Physics exam, reading an extract from the discussions between Einstein and Bohr about the epistemological problems of atomic physicsâ€”a topic everyone ponders while waiting for the bus, of course! Einstein, conservative about his views about the theory, had a particular interest in posing thought experiments to checkmate his contender.
